loans.name: Alex Fernando

texts.es:
Alex tiene 18 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

Alex  se dedica al comercio a la venta de quesos además se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá obtener la leche para la elaboración del queso.

La compra las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda y las ventas de los quesos  lo realiza bajo pedidos en Guaranda, San Miguel, Chimbo.

El sueño es comprar un camioneta para transportar . Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar del deporte. En especial del futbol.
texts.en:
Alex is 18 years old, single with no children and lives with his mother in the city of Guaranda, province of Bolívar.  He is a member of the communal bank  "Los Pinos" which is comprised of 14 members of the same agricultural community about 40 minutes away from the Pangua Community offices.

Alex sells cheese and raises cattle and pigs for a living.  He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow so he can obtain milk to make cheese.  He carries out his purchases in the city of Guaranda and sells cheese on an order basis in Guaranda, San Miguel and Chimbo.

One day he would like to buy a transport truck, but the most difficult challenge he faces is the lack of money.  In his free time he enjoys sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She’s married and her husband is not doing any work now. They both have two children between 10 and 14 years old who are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking person. For the past four years, she has been selling rice, toothpaste, pepper, etc in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. By sharing a taxi, she is able to get her goods to her market  table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, toothpaste, pepper, etc  for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, toothpaste, pepper, etc  for her business

loans.name: Azimakhon

texts.en:
Azimakhon has run a business selling fruits since 2008. She lives with her mother and her 2 children, a boy and a girl.  
Since last year, she has been rebuilding her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. She must repair the roof of her house so she is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy slate. Since she bought goods for the new season, she does not have the funds to buy the slate. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy slate for repairing the roof of her house

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough cooked into a smooth, whitish paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 4 years. 
Ekua is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 
Ekua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Francisca no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta criar y cuidar animales y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Francisca trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, adicionalmente también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Francisca se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de puertas, ventanas y calaminas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder acondicionar su casa propia, ya que en poco tiempo desea mudarse a vivir en ella, de esta manera Francisca y su familia tendrán mayor bienestar y seguridad, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Francisca, 56, lives in the city of Chiclayo in the district of Guadalupe. She lives with her son, whom she loves and is the most important thing in her life. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic lady, who devotes all her time and effort into raising her son. Francisca has always been both a father and mother to him.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources Francisca had to start work from a young age to help her parents and could not pursue a professional career. In her spare time, she likes to raise and care for animals and sometimes cooks a delicious fried fish dish to share with her family.
Using her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Francisca works as a kitchen helper in a restaurant in her hometown. In addition, she also sells beauty products. She works every day, usually for around 10 hours. She enjoys her work and believes that her success is due to her good performance and the kind treatment she gives others.

Francisca is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their assistance she will be able to purchase doors, windows and roofing sheets to help build her home, as she wants to move in as soon as possible. This loan will provide greater comfort and security for Francisca and her family, and she will continue to work and strive to achieve her dream of owning her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase doors, windows and roofing sheets

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Lucio no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito para poder estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lucio se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra maíz, Lucio trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lucio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Lucio podrá obtener una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su última hija convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Lucio, 64, lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and five children who he loves and are the main motivation in his life.  He is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic man who makes every effort, together with his wife, to provide for the family.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and a need to start working from a very young age to help his parents, Lucio was unable to finish his primary education, making it impossible to get a professional degree.  In his free time he enjoys watching television and somestimes even cooks a delicious roast chicken to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Lucio works in agriculture.  He says he has a small patch of land where he grows corn, and works every day for about eight hours.  He enjoys what he does and believes he is doing well because of his experience and kindness to others.

Lucio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can pay for the cost of crop fertilizer, irrigation and harvesting.  This will mean he will produce a good crop and be able to continue working toward his greatest dream of seeing his youngest daughter obtain a professional degree.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of crop fertilizer, irrigation and harvest.

loans.name: Al Dalaa Group

texts.en:
Dalal is the featured borrower of Al Dalaa's Group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva' partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Dalal is the one sitting in the middle. She is a 51-year-old married woman who has been working as a hairdresser from her house for 30 years. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and special talent. She works from her house. The loan will be invested in buying necessary hair and beauty cosmetics needs, in addition to special medical needs.

Fayza is the one sitting on the left. She is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has been selling accessories for three years. She is a hard worker and has a very good relationship and communication with her customers.The loan will help her increase her accessories collection and renew her house furniture.

Linda is a 52-year-old widowed woman who has been working as a teacher for 33 years. The loan she applied for will be invested in doing necessary maintenance for her living room, since she accepts students at home. She works as an after school tutor to make sure that she has an additional income business that will help her in her income and family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing supplies and beauty cosmetics

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 39 years old. He lives in the Gurjaani District in Kakheti Region with his wife and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a  family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Tamaz works in Border policy and his wife works at a local hospital. They both get a monthly income. It is hardly enough to supply food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tamaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Tamaz will open a bakery. He will purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials for baking Georgian bread and Georgian cheese bread. As he has party at a crowded space where he plans to open a bakery, he thinks the business will be profitable. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 32 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the larger local market in Montsorrade. She lives together with her fiance, who is currently unemployed. They have five children from 7 to 17 years of age who are in school and live at home.
Kou describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past six years, she has been running a market where she sells rice, pepper, vita (a juice drink), oil, etc. She likes her business because of the ways her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest brother. She gets her goods to the market by means of shared taxi. 
Kou is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita (a juice drink), oil, etc for her business. In future, she plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita (a juice drink), oil, etc for her business,

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked rice in Besease (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 12 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 5 children. 
Esi has identified growing demand among consumers for her product. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children are given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva, de 29 años,  es una mujer alegre y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Octavio con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 09, 07, 03 y 02 años de edad respectivamente .El trabajo de Nerva consiste en la venta de comida en el mercado de su localidad. Se inició en este negocio porque un vecino le cedió su puesto en el mercado y desde ese momento se dedica a este negocio. Comenta que su actividad económica es bastante rentable  ya que en el mercado donde está acuden personas de toda la ciudad que adquieren diariamente sus comidad. Al comienzo tenia problemas económicos y no contaba con el dinero suficiente para emprender su negocio pero con el tiempo pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para lograr tener sus propios ingresos .Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 08 con Kiva, tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo razón por la cual se compromete a pagar  su cuota de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado  de 2000 soles comprará utensilios para su trabajo como cuchillos,tenedore, cucharas ,mandiles, entre otros.
texts.en:
Nerva, 29, is a cheerful dreamer who lives in her own house with her husband, Octavio, and their four children, ages nine, seven, three and two.   Nerva earns a living selling food at the town market.  She started the business after a neighbor transferred the stall to her, and claims it is quite profitable because in the market there are always people from all over the city who buy their food daily.

At first she ran into economic problems and did not have enough money to start her business but over time was able to save enough to start earning her own income.  This is her eighth Kiva loan and, since she wants to continue expanding, she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

Nerva plans to use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy work utensils such as knives, forks, spoons, aprons, etc.

loans.use: To buy utensils such as knives, forks, spoons, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 21-years-old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Sofia has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, salt, and milk. 

To help expand her business, Sofia has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities such as milk, bread, and water, and will help Sofia to generate greater profits and provide for some basic needs of her family. Sofia hopes that in the future she will be able to invest more capital in her business. 

Sofia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities such as milk, bread, and water

loans.name: Iralda Margoth

texts.es:
Iralda tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con  unos familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

Iralda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas y crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar la tierra para prepararla y sembrar.  La compra lo realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. 

El sueño es comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mantener el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar descansando en recompensa del arduo trabajo que día a día se realiza.
texts.en:
Iralda, 19, is single, has no children and lives with relatives in the city of Guaranda, province of Bolívar.  She is a member of the communal bank "Los Pinos" which is comprised of 14 members of the same agricultural community 40 minutes from the Pangua Community offices.

Iralda works in agriculture and grows potatoes and raises cattle.  She is requesting a loan to buy land so she can increase crop production.  She will be buy it in the city of Guaranda.

Her goal is to buy a car, but one of the challenges she faces is keeping her work steady.  In her free time she likes to relax to compensate for the hard work she puts in every day.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Ekua sells cloth in Besease (near Cape Coast), and has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 5 children. Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more cloth, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 42 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She and her fiance live together and her fiance is not working now. They both have five children between 8 and 28 years old. The children are in school and only two live at home. She described herself as a hardworking person. For the past six years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells rice, fufu (fufu is made out of cassava), and soup in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister. She walks every day to buy her ingredients since her shop is much closer to local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bush meat, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She says thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bush meat, etc  for her business

loans.name: Nashkhun

texts.en: Nashkhun is from Krashen village in the Shirak region, where she lives with her husband and son. Together with her husband, Nashkhun is engaged in agriculture. She keeps 4 cows, 14 sheep, 2 pigs, 20 chickens and 10 colonies of bees and also cultivates wheat and barley. Nashkhun gets milk and other milk products and her husband sells the gathered agricultural products locally. The income from selling is very important for Nashkhun and her husband to be able to sustain the family's life. As farming business is the only source of their income, Nashkhun would like to expand it. Having no financial means to do so, Nashkhun has requested a loan from SEF International. With the loan's help, she will purchase five sheep, fertilizer and seeds for the land cultivation. This will give Nashkhun an opportunity to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and gather high income, which is vital for Nashkhun and her family.

loans.use: to buy five sheep, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Artur, at the age of 20, found a means to make a living by breeding cattle. Now he has 11 years of experience in that field, and his livestock currently includes 30 cows, 150 sheep and 50 chickens. Artur sells the gathered meat and milk locally and sells it in the local markets. That agricultural income is very important for Artur to sustain his family of six -- Artur himself, his parents, wife and two children. Due to his hard work, he has gained many loyal customers who prefer to only buy meat and milk from him.

Now, in order to meet his clients' demands, Artur wants to increase his livestock. He has requested a loan from SEF International to purchase eight calves. This will enable Artur to gather more agricultural products and sell it at a good price. He hopes that his hard work will bring him the farm of his dream and will ease his problems.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves.

loans.name: Carolina Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Carolina, de 50 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Managua, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 6 años. Pero primera experiencia fue desde muy joven vendiendo ropa, zapatos por encargo viajaba a los departamentos a vender con estos ingresos logro mantener a sus hijos. Desde hace 6 años inicio con la venta de cosméticos sus clientes la mayoría trabajan en empresas, otras son amas de casa o trabajadoras de fábricas. 
El día de las madres está cerca y es un momento excelente para las ventas y no quiere perder la oportunidad por eso está necesitando el crédito para comprar perfumes, anillos, cadenas, pulseras, cosméticos. Pues desea ofrecer más variedad de productos a su clientela. Unos de sus planes que desea realizar es la mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para alquilar una parte ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de cuartos para estudiantes.
texts.en:
Carolina is 50 years old and lives in the city of Managua. She is mother to 4 children who all live independently.  She has sold cosmetics for the past 6 years.  Her experience began when she was very young and she sold clothing and handmade shoes by traveling to different regions. The money she earned was used to support her children.  For the past 6 years she has sold cosmetics to her clients, the majority of whom work for large companies, while others are homemakers or workers in factories.

Mother's Day is coming up and it's an excellent time for selling her products.  She doesn't want to miss out on this opportunity and so she needs a loan to buy perfumes, rings, chains, watches, and cosmetics.  She wants to offer a bigger variety of products to her customers.  She hopes to one day improve the infrastructure of her house so that she can rent rooms to students.

loans.use: to buy perfume, rings, chains, watches, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana,44 años de edad es una humilde comerciante , casada, madre de 2 hijos , viven en la ciudad de Managua , ella vende ropa usada actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años . Su primera experiencia como comerciante fue cuando vendía galletas en los colegios. Años después decidió vender ropa usada de manera ambulante, puerta a puerta, viajaba a los largo de toda la ciudad en busca de clientes. Hoy está requiriendo el crédito para comprar ropa usada y aprovechar la temporada alta del día de las madres para vender más productos. Por lo pronto le gustaría hacer crecer más su negocio cada día y salir fuera de Managua a ofrecer su mercadería de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and she is a merchant. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in the city of Managua and she sells used clothing, an activity that she has been doing for 10 years.  She began working as a merchant by selling cookies to students.  Years later, she decided to sell used clothing by foot, door to door, traveling long distances around the city in search of customers.  

Today she needs a loan so that she can buy used clothing and take advantage of the upcoming Mother's Day when she can sell even more products.  In the short term, she would like to be able to increase her daily business and leave Managua when selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 1 year, Joweria has been working hard to manage her business of selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale, and will help Joweria to generate greater profits and pay rent for the shop. Joweria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Joweria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 40 years old. He is a married man and has four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the breadwinner of his family. He is a teacher getting a low salary, who tries to work hard every day to be able to offer the best to his family. He feels embarrassed when guests come to visit and he does not have furniture for his home. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase furniture for his house. His dream is to keep on acquiring the things he lacks, the challenge he faces is fighting any problems that arise.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville North, which has the larger local market in Montsorrade. She is married, and her husband does not work now. They have 8 children between 5 and 15 years of age who are in school and live at home. 
Victoria describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the past ten years, she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, onions, etc in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She gets her goods to market by shared taxi. 
Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onions, etc for her business. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onions, etc for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fabric in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Mary is married and has 7 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels by buying fabrics.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi grew up in poverty and without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Esi is an entrepreneur who sells cooked rice in Besease (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 12 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. 
Esi has identified the growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet customer needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to ensure that her child will be given every opportunity to further distance the family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Dúo Shaday De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
DUO SHADAY DE SAN MATEO
Este dúo está conformado por doña Gloria Marisol, ella tiene 34 de edad, y tiene tres niñas las tres estudian en la escuelita local de San Mateo de donde son originarias, doña Gloria se dedica a la agricultura como, siembra de ejote, arveja, suchini y frijol, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de dos cuerdas de ejote, su propósito es seguir apoyando a su esposo en los ingresos de su hogar, eso lo logra gracias a la entrega de su producto por mayor a sus clientes de su pueblo, su deseo es seguir mejorando su producción,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas de ejotes para el cultivo.
texts.en:
The group Duo Shaday de San Mateo is comprised of two people.  Gloria Marisol is 34 years old and has three children that attend the local school in San Mateo, the town in which they live.  Gloria works in agriculture by growing green beans, peas, zucchini, and string beans.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy bean seeds.  

She works hard so that she can continue helping her husband earn an income for the household.  She can do this thanks to the fact that most of her customers live in their town.  She hopes to continue improving production and so she is asking for a loan so that she can buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mahougnon 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Akouavi Elisabeth celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, est âgée de 50 ans. Akouavi Elisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Akouavi Elisabeth est mariée à un certain André. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Akouavi Elisabeth vend des boules d'akassa (fait à base de maïs) depuis vingt cinq ans. Akouavi Elisabeth s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Akouavi Elisabeth s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON 1 pour consentir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahougnon 1 is a group of three people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, named Akouavi Elisabeth, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. She is 50 years old and did not go to school. She is married to a certain Andre. The couple has three children; all go to school and all are under their care. Akouavi Elisabeth lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the household expenses. 

To support her needs, Akouavi Elisabeth has been selling akassa balls (made with a corn base) for 25 years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

In order to strengthen her business and meet the needs of her customers, Akouavi Elisabeth joins with the other members of the Mahougnon 1 group for their fourth loan from Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Nazibrola

texts.en:
Nazibrola is 58 years old. She lives in Akhaltsikhe district with her husband Ivane, her 22-year-old son, her daughter in-law and her granddaughter who is 3 years old. Nazibrola has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her family's low income and poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from trading. Nazibrola rents a car to go to the capital city. She purchases household goods from a big market at a wholesale price and brings it to her village to sell among the villagers with a price markup.  The family also owns a plot of agricultural land where haricot, maize and potatoes are grown. The harvested products are generally used for individual use and sometimes for trading at the local markets to earn a  small income.

Nazibrola has requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Nazibrola has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Nazibrola will purchase a car. She will not have to rent a car for her trading business anymore and it will significantly increase her income. She will also be able to purchase a bigger stock of household goods and offer better choice to her clients. As Nazibrola is already known in this field among the villagers her business will be more successful. With the increased income she will be able to provide better living conditions for her big family.

loans.use: to buy a car for her trading business.

loans.name: Moimah

texts.en:
Moimah  is 36 years old and lives at Paynesville North which has the larger local market in Montsorrade. She is single and has two children aged 2 and 6, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past five years she has been selling soap, toothpaste, body creams and sprays in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways her customers have responded to it. She had started this business with money given to her by her mother and by using shared taxis to enable her to get her goods from the market.

She now requests a loan to purchase more soap, toothpaste, body creams and sprays for her business. She plans to buy a pieces of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, body creams and sprays for her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is married with four children and two of the children go to school. She has a tailoring business and has been doing this for 9 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of material and thread. She doesn't have any other income generating activities. She works in a shop six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen is a farmer from Hatsik village where she lives with her husband, their young daughter her husband's brother.
She has been running her farm for 7 years and has supported her family with the income from the farm. Ashkhen's husband went abroad in order to financially support his family. But now the farming business is the only source of income for Ashkhen.

She has applied for a loan to develop her business. With this loan she plans to purchase fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. The loan will also be used to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and covering fuel costs. As a woman with lot of daily responsibilities, it is very difficult for Ashkhen to do farming and at the same time take care of little daughter. Ashkhen hopes that this loan will ease her farming problems and will give her opportunity to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase forage, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Cynthia did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Cynthia sells cassava in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 12 years. She is married to a machine operator, and together they have 3 children. Cynthia uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Cynthia will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Cynthia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava.

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVAR” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Clotilde es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados, venta de ropa, venta de medias, venta de busos, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Clotilde es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su suegra y en la actualidad sigue con ese rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Bolivar" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the Los Andes regional office.  The group is made up of six members and is run by a board of director with Clotilde as the president.  The members have different kinds of businesses, including: selling footwear, selling clothing, selling socks, selling tracksuits and selling potatoes.

This loan will benefit the microenterprises in the group presided over by Clotilde.  Clotilde tells us that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago following an invitation from a friend who was already a member.  Following advice from her mother-in-law, Clotilde started a business selling footwear and she continues with this same business now.

Clotilde will use this loan to increase her capital, by buying footwear from the big markets in the city of La Paz.  Later she will sell on the footwear.  This type of work helps Clotilde to earn a living to maintain her household.  She has a partner and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Clotilde responds, saying that she likes the health advice that is provided.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Christ Est Vivant Group

texts.fr: CHRIST EST VIVANT est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Diane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Diane est âgée de 31 ans. Diane a peu fréquenté l'école. Diane est mariée à un certain Gildas. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Diane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Diane vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis sept ans. Diane s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Diane s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT pour consentir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Christ est Vivant is a group of three people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, named Diane, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and has attended a little bit of school. Diane is married to a certain Gildas. The couple has six children; all go to school and all are under their care. Diane lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the household expenses. 

To do this, Diane has been selling hair extensions and cosmetics for seven years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. 

In order to strengthen her business and meet the needs of her customers, Dianne joins with the other members of the Christ Est Vivant group for their fourth loan from Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Ahdiman

texts.en:
Ahdiman is 53 years old, married, and has three sons aged 17, 15 and 12. His sons go to school. He has big plans for his sons' future. As his wife stays at home, he is the only one earning an income. Ahdiman is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. He now lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his wife and children. He started his agriculture business 7 years ago. 

Ahdiman needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy calves and sheep. He sells meat and milk products in the bazaar. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Ahdiman wants to have big farm. This will be a more profitable business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep.

loans.name: Vepkhia

texts.en:
Vepkhia is 30 years old. He lives in Kutaisi district, West Georgia with his 24-year-old wife Tinatin, brother in-law and 4 year old son. Vepkhia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
Vepkhia is a shoe trader. He buys them from Greece at wholesale prices and sells them among his villagers with a mark-up to earn a small profit. Tinatin’s mother is working abroad and is sending transfers to the family.

Vepkhia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Vepkhia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vepkhia will rent a shop at the local trading center and purchase more stocks of shoes. As he is already well known among his villagers and because of this Vephkia decided to try and expand his business and open a shop. He is a very hard working man and will try his best to have his business be successful and earn a better income for the family. With the increased income Vepkhia will be able to insure better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to rent a shop and purchase stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. Efua is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms. Shazia is a 27-year-old married woman and has run a milk selling business with her husband for the past 10 years. The man shown in the photo is Shazia’s husband. They have one buffalo and two cows to milk and then they sell their milk to many of their neighbors to earn enough income to meet their family’s expenses. They feel pleasure while doing this business to be able to secure their children’s future. They have four children and one them goes to school. They need to earn more income to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. Shazia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy one more buffalo to better fulfill the needs of her customers. She hopes to increase their production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more revenue.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase milk production.

loans.name: Candida Natalia

texts.es:
Doña Cándida es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora con 48 años de edad que no deja de soñar en grande la cual tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado. Ella es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a la misma actividad. De su matrimonio tiene un hijo el cual depende de ellos y vive bajo su mismo techo. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad la cual la aprendió desde muy joven inculcada por sus padres y decidió continuar con esta actividad ya que sus padres la facilitaron un terreno el cual se lo dieron como herencia para que lo cultivara y generara sus propios ingresos el cual está ubicado a una distancia de 4 kilómetros de distancia al cual se transportan en bestia.

Doña Cándida solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es una enfermedad que afecta los cultivos de café si no se trata a tiempo es posible que se contamine y se pierda la cosecha completa.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones que puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo.
texts.en:
Cándida is a happy, plucky and enterprising 48-year old woman and she always dreams big.  Cándida only completed the first three years of primary school.  She is married and receives support from her husband who works with Cándida.  The couple have a son who is still dependent on his parents and lives under the same roof.  Cándida has a lot of experience in her trade, which she learned from her parents from a very young age.  She decided to continue with this work when her parents provided her with a piece of land to grow crops on and to generate her own income.  The land is four kilometres from her home and she gets there on an animal.

Cándida is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure and pest-control substances for her coffee crops.  Nowadays these types of products are very expensive and if there is a blight that affects the crops, without quick treatment the entire crop can become contaminated and the whole harvest lost.

Cándida's dreams for the future include having a larger coffee plantation which continues to do well, to provide support for the family and, perhaps, it will last so that her children and grandchildren will be able to live off of it too.  Cándida hopes that future generations will be able to profit from her and her husband's efforts.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and pest-control substances for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any other additional family members. She has a clinic and has been in this business for twenty years. She has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda Shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more drugs like boxes of syrups and injections. She works in a shop that she rents and sells on retail basis seven days of the week. Her major business challenges include taxes, defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked pharmacy and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premise.

loans.use: to buy more syrups and injections.

loans.name: Granit

texts.en:
Granit is 21 years old and single. He lives with his entire family in the northern part of Kosovo. Granit is an ambitious and hardworking male who puts in a lot of effort to generate money. He currently works as a seller in a private company. His father also works as a technical worker but with a very low salary. 

They live in a small town which was destroyed by the war. It is quite clear that unemployment is high and the town is not very developed. They have been planning to improve the conditions of their house for a long time but they could not manage to save the money to renovate the internal facade.

Granit now requests a loan in order to renovate the  facade and flooring. The loan will help him to improve their living conditions. He is hoping in the future to find a better paid job. His goal is to save the money for his future. He is aware of Kiva lenders and he wants to thank all of them!

loans.use: to renovate the facade and flooring of his house.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Aisha is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks and feeds for the poultry farm, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feeds for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Sreten

texts.en:
Sreten is 28 years old. He is married with 3 children; the oldest is six years old and youngest two years old. They live in the ethnic minority community of Kosovo. Sreten works in a primary school as a technical worker. His job is the family’s main source of income.

He has been working this job for a long time and still he doesn't earn enough to support the needs of his family. Years ago he started to build a house but the income he earns is not enough to finish the house.

The loan Sreten is requesting is to buy construction materials to finish their house. His goal is to finish the house to have a bigger space and offer better security for his family.
He appreciates this help very much!

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling plastic bowls in Besease (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Ama is married and has 1 child. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of plastic bowls, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plastic bowls.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Ms. Aziz is a 40-year-old married woman and has run a milk-selling business with her husband for the past two years. She has three cows that produce milk and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors. She also makes butter and cheese with this milk to generate extra revenue. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They feel pleasure doing this business. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, healthcare and clothing. For this reason she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy one more cow to fulfill the demands of their customers which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Faith has been working hard to manage her business, which sells fast foods.
To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sacks of irish potatoes and cooking oil to make the snacks, and will help Faith to generate greater profits and improve on her family’s standard of living. Faith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.
Faith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of irish potatoes and cooking oil to make the snacks.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Doña Olga es una mujer trabajadora y honrada de 44 años de edad casa da que de su matrimonio tiene un solo hijo. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. En compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo y siembra de café actividad inculcada por sus padres desde muy joven la cual sigue ejerciendo en compañía de su esposo. La tierra que ella trabaja y cultiva es propia gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por ella y su esposo y los muchos años de sacrificio para obtenerla. Sus Clientes son intermediarios que llegan a la zona a comprar el producto, vecinos y demás que consumen para uso personal o para revenderlo.  

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Su sueño es poder con el tiempo cultivar y extender más su cultivo de café, darle la oportunidad a su hijo para que pueda educarse a nivel universitario aprendiendo una carrera que le ayude a superase y a crecer como persona en un ambiente al que el puedan adaptarse con toda facilidad.
texts.en:
Forty-four year old Olga is hard-working and honest.  She is married and has only one child.  Olga completed primary school but could not continue studying due to a lack of financial support from her parents.  Alongside her husband, Olga works in agriculture, sowing and growing coffee.  She learned this trade from her parents from a young age and continues the work with her husband.  The land they work is their own, thanks to their efforts and many years of sacrifice which allowed them to buy it.  Olga and her husband's clients are middle-men who come to the region to buy their product as well as neighbours and others who buy the coffee for personal use to resell.

Olga is applying for a loan to buy fertilisers and manure to maintain her coffee crops, so that she can have a healthy and fruitful harvest to generate an income, make a profit and continue to invest in their work.

Olga's dream, with time, is to continue to grow her crops and expand.  She wants to give her son the opportunity to be educated up to university level and to learn a profession so that he can do well and grow as a person in an environment where he can adapt to anything.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nemanja

texts.en:
Nemanja is single and 28 years old. He lives with his family in a minority community. He is very ambitious and a hard worker. Nemanaja is a sporty guy and he always dreamed of having his own business. He managed to realize his dream over a month ago.

His business is a fitness club. He started with a few pieces of equipment and has now asked for a loan to buy more fitness equipment in order to satisfy his clientele. The loan will help him to increase income and to gain more customers. In this way he supports his family. Nemanja hopes in the future to expand his business and hire more workers.

His goal is to get married in the future and to have his own family. He appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy fitness equipment.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Ms. Manzooran is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. For about 8 years she is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people in her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build up a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. By doing so she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Zesi

texts.en:
Zesi is a 38-year-old married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past twenty years, he has operated a tailoring business, sewing clothes and selling them from his home to his neighbors and passersby. 
With the loan that he is requesting of KES 15,000 he wants to purchase stock of sewing threads, needles, cloth materials and rent a business premises for easy access by his clients. 
He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sewing threads, needles, cloth materials and  rent a business premises.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her sister. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she generates additional income from dry cleaning. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She sells on retail basis six days a week and works from her home. She aspires to sell on a wholesale basis, buy a delivery van to ease the burden with transportation and also to build rental rooms. She decided to works with MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Don Sergio es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene un hijo que depende de él, así como toda su familia,  el Señor es el único que trabaja y proporciona el sustento diario a su familia. Con esfuerzo propio pudo construir su vivienda aunque sea de tablas, laminas de zinc y el piso de tierra, ahora pretende mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, por lo que solicita financiamiento para lograr su objetivo que es de iniciar a construir su vivienda de piedras canteras y cemento tendiendo una parte ya comenzada, espera terminarla por completo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have a young son who depends on him, as does his entire family. He is the only one that works and provides a livelihood for his family. 

With much effort Sergio managed to build the family home, made of boards and zinc sheeting with an earth floor. His goal is to improve the condition of their house, therefore he is requesting a loan to help him achieve this by building with quarried stone and cement. He has already started this process, and hopes to complete it little by little.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, blocks and quarried stone

loans.name: Vyukakare Group

texts.fr:
Martine  fait partie du groupe  Vyukakare  et   habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 48 ans. Elle a  6 enfants,  tous  étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  manioc  depuis 32  ans. 

Elle  est à son  dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  manioc  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Martine is part of the Vyukakare group and lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and a widow. She has six children, all of whom go to school. 

She has been selling cassava for 32 years. 

She is on her 17th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava to resell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to buy cassava to resell

loans.name: Paola Beatriz

texts.es:
Paola tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con lo abuelos maternos en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.
Paola se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la  crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado vacuno. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar el ganado y mejorar la raza.  La compra lo realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. 
El sueño  es mejorar la economía. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de fuentes de trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estudiar y disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Paola is 19 years old, single and has no children. She lives with her grandparents (from her mother’s side) in the city of Guaranda, Bolívar province.

Paola is a member of the communal bank Los Pinos, composed of fourteen members, all from the same community, which is located 40 minutes away from the office at Comunidad Pangua. They all work in agriculture. 

Paola works in agriculture, growing corn and raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle. With the help of this loan, she will be able to increase their number and improve their breed. She will buy them in the city of Guaranda.

Her dream is to improve her economic situation. Her challenge is the lack of employment. During her free time, she likes to study and to enjoy the carnival and its celebrations.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase machine tools to balance tires

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Ms. Farzana is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four children; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up. Then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.  She has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase one more cow. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been stitching bed sheets and pillow covers for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread with bundles of cloth in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd  loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with bundles of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Shahina

texts.en:
Ms Shahina is a 37-year-old married woman. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 15 years now. Her husband assists her in running this business successfully. She started this line of work at a very young age. 

During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

To meet with the demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers without fail. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income and dreams of using part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use:
to buy reels of threads in different colors with
packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms Nusrat is a 49-year-old married woman. She is involved in a business of making artificial jewelery. She makes necklaces, earrings and bracelets beautifully and earns enough income through her sales. She is running this business with the support of her husband and has gained five years of experience in this field. 

In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Nusrat requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, artificial gold and dozens of gems and pearls in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and intends to use it on providing good and quality education to their children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver and artificial gold with dozens of gems and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Ms Perveen is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of clothes trading for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers. Perveen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers.

loans.name: Obert

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 46 year old Obert from Bulawayo. He is married with four children, two attending school. Obert runs a retail business selling kitchenware, clothes and footwear in an open market area. The business has been in operation for 3 years. He says the main challenges faced are unavailability of funds to borrow for working capital. 

Obert has requested a loan of $500 to purchase stock for resale, which includes kitchenware and utensils, clothes and footwear. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to pay college and university fees for his children. In the future Obert plans to open a retail shop in the CBD (Central Business District).

loans.use: to buy stock, which includes kitchenware, utensils, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Ms Suriya is a 46-year-old married woman operating a business of milk sales. She has gained years of experience in this field. She has 2 calves and 5 cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter which she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her five children with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. 

It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for her cows. She hopes to get an increase in the amount of milk produced which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for her cows.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 54-year-old married woman. She has had a business of doing hand embroidery for the past many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. In order to meet with the demands of her customers she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Razia hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru: Фаризе 21 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она умная и активная студентка 4 курса Педагогического Университета Таджикистана. Фариза учится по специальности преподавателя математики и информатики. Фариза является одной из активных студентов и учится хорошо и отлично. Она участвовала на нескольких олимпиадах университета и занимала видные места. Фариза после окончания университета хочет работать в школе. Она очень довольна, что выбрала профессию педагога. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fariza is 21, married, and has one child. She is a smart and active fourth-year student at the Tajikistan Pedagogical University, and is majoring in teaching math and informatics. She is one of the most active students and is doing extremely well in her studies. She participated in in several university Olympics and placed highly. After graduating, Fariza wants to teach elementary school. She is very glad that she chose teaching as her profession. She needs to pay her tuition, but has no money. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition and awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition at the Pedagogical University

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms Zahida is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of trading clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes of the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different summer season clothes, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is 38 years old, a vigorous, married woman and a mother of six children. She is expert at doing hand embroidery and makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials in large quantities, such as thread, sequins and pearls, to meet the increasing demand. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for 7 years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

Razia shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in large quantities, such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 22 years old and lives in Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She is single with a 3-year-old child, which is in school and lives at home. She describes herself as a serious and hardworking person. For the past four years she has been selling palm oil at the local market. She likes her business because it is profitable, and she started this business with money given to her by mother. With a shared taxi she is able to get her goods to her location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business, and she hopes to one day buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia so they are able to help small business people to increase their sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Tubas near Nablus. Mohammad owns a small cafeteria where he sells soft drinks and sandwiches. This business is profitable, in large part, because it located in a good area.
Mohammad would like to develop his cafeteria by buying more tables and chairs. So he took a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN.
This loan will help Mohammad to improve his cafeteria and increase his income. Mohammad appears in photo.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru: Идигул проживает в районе Шахринав, который находится в 30 км западнее столицы Таджикистана. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и является матерью одного ребенка. Ее муж работает в хлебопекарном цехе. Идигул помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи. Она обладает народным ремеслом и занимается вышиванием ковриков для молитвы. Этой сфере она посвятила 10 лет своей жизни и является мастерицей в своем деле. Идигул запрашивает кредит для приобретения ткани и ниток для вышивания. В будущем на полученную выручку от деятельности она хочет провести торжество по случаю обрезания сына.
texts.en: Idigul lives in Shakhrinav, which is about 30 kilometers west of the capital of Tajikistan. She is 27, married, and the mother of one. Her husband works at a bakery. Idigul helps her husband to provide for the family. She is a folk artisan and does embroidery for prayer mats. She has devoted 10 years to this type of work and is highly skilled. Idigul is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread for doing embroidery. She wants to use the earnings to pay for her son's circumcision ceremony.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for doing embroidery

loans.name: Lobaroy

texts.ru: Лобарой добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Лобарой более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как ячмень и другие зерновые культуры. Она является основной кормилицей в семье, так как ее муж помогает ей введение бизнеса и не имеет отдельного источника дохода. Лобарой хочет расширить свой бизнес скотоводством, так как она дома имеет хорошие условия для скотоводства. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она будет откармливать скот за счет собственного земельного участка, где она выращивает зерновые культуры. Она ждет вашу доброту и как честный человек обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Lobaroy is an honest and hardworking woman. She is 42, married, and has two children. She has been growing barley and other grains for more than 15 years.
