La cliente Juana, vive en la perimetral, ella comenzó con su negocio cuando ingreso a una capacitación en una fundación a donde aprendió manualidades entre una de estas hacer muñecas de trapo. En la actualidad tiene su negocio de venta de muñecas de trapo. 

Para realizar las muñecas de trapo necesita materia prima como telas, hilos etc. Poco a poco a incrementado su negocio. La única dificultad es que en ciertas ocasiones se enferma. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas e hilos para poder hacer mas muñecas y venderlas. En el futuro quiere tener una micro empresa establecida.
texts.en: Juana lives along the beltway and started her business when she took a course at a foundation where she learned to make manual arts among which was making rag dolls.  She currently has a business selling rag dolls.  To make the rag dolls she needs raw materials like fabric, thread, etc.  She’s gradually increased her business.  The only difficulty she faces is when she gets sick occasionally.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread to be able to make more dolls and to sell them.  In future, she’d like to have an established micro business firm.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Katia Marcela

texts.es:
Katia, se dedica a la venta de joyas de fantasía,  enchape y lociones. El tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su mama, la cual tiene 53 años de edad y asimismo tiene cinco hermanos; este oficio lo realiza desde hace tres años, lo lleva a cabo en ratos libres de su trabajo y los fines de semana.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cadenas, aretes, anillos, pulseras, entre otros productos; le ayudara a aumentar el inventario y obtener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Katia sells costume jewelry, plated items, and lotions.  She is 28 years old and lives with her 53 year old mother and five siblings.  She has had this business for three years and has been doing this in her free time and on the weekends.

She needs this loan to buy chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, and other things.  This will help her increase her inventory and earnings.

Her dream is to strengthen her business and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia,solicita un nuevo prestamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo, ya que estos son una fuente financiera que ayudan a obtener ganancias; Este le permitira comprar tela para uniformes, zippers, botones, hilo, blonda, entre otros; este le ayudara adquirir la tela para que los estudiantes no tengan que ir a comprar a otro lugar, asimismo tener todo lo necesario para elaborar el trabajo.
El credito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las ventas y utilidades, ya que se dedicaba a la venta de comida; las condiciones economicas y las circusntancias familiares se han optimizado, es por ello que opta por un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue investing, since it is a financial source that helps her obtain earnings.  This allows her to buy fabric for uniforms, zippers, buttons, thread and doilies among other things.  This will help her get fabric so that students don't have to go buy it at another location, in this way she'll have everything necessary to do the work.

The previous loan helped her improve sales and utilities, since she worked in selling food.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved, and due to this she has decided to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for uniforms, zippers, buttons, thread and doilies among other things

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married, and her husband is a businessman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and theft in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 47 years old and has two children. Delia is married and has one child who is in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda earns a living through her milled rice retailing business. Chanda is a married woman from Jagna, Bohol and a mother of four children. She has been in business for more than 2 years now. 

Chanda is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her business and more importantly her income. In addition, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Belgica Yanett

texts.es:
La cliente Belgica vive en Quevedo. Comenzó su negocio de crianza de cerdos y pollos para tener ingresos y asi poder ayuda a su hijo en los gastos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio pero a pesar de que ya tenia una actividad económica ella decidió comenzar vendiendo productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumes etc. 

Poco a poco comenzó a ser una mujer emprendedora, hasta ahora que tiene sus dos negocios ya establecidos con clientes y les vende pollos, también perfumes, cosméticos y cremas.    

El préstamo lo quiere invertir en la comprar de pollos y útiles escolares para su hijo de 15 años de edad quien ya ingreso al colegio. En el futuro quiere incrementar en su negocio y así tener mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Belgica lives in Quevedo.  She started her business raising chickens and pigs in order to earn income to be able to help with her son’s expenses.  She gradually increased business but even though she already had an economic activity she decided to start selling beauty products like cosmetics, perfume, etc.

She gradually began to become an entrepreneur and to date has two well-established businesses with customers to whom she sells chickens but also perfume, cosmetics and creams.

She wants to use the loan to buy chickens and school supplies for her 15-year-old son who has enrolled in high-school.  In future, she’d like to increase business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy chickens and school supplies.

loans.name: Zam's Group

texts.en:
Zam's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Zam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Zam has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans. 

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge and more maize, rice, sugar and soap to sell.  This will help Zam to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Zam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her poultry farm and be a big supplier in the whole town. 

Zam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more a fridge and maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина замужняя женщина. Ей 34 года. Она мать несовершеннолетних детей. Нигина со своей семьей живет в городе Кургантюбе. Она предприимчивая и предусмотрительная  женщина. Нигина имеет среднее образование. Она занималась продажей женских одежд  в течение 10 лет. Но, к сожалению рынок, где она работала сгорел. Теперь Нигина хочет восстановить и продолжить бизнес. Для осуществления цели ей необходима денежная сумма. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения товара, и начать бизнес заново. В деятельности ей будут помогать друзья. Нигина любит свое дело и ей нравится получать доход от бизнеса. В будущем она планирует расширить деятельность и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Nigina is a married woman. She is 34 years old. She has underage children. Nigina lives with her family in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is an enterprising and prudent person. Nigina has secondary education. She has been selling women’s clothing for 10 years. But, unfortunately, the market where she used to work burned down. Now Nigina would like to restore and continue her business. To make this happen, she needs funds. She is requesting a loan to buy stock and to relaunch her business. Her friends will help her out. Nigina enjoys her work and likes being able to earn money from her business. In the future, she plans to expand her activity and increase the standards of living.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
This is Roy. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the needed materials in his barber shop. He was able to generate more income which helped a lot in their household expenditures and his children's education. He and his wife are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan to buy clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials needed in his barber shop. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Roy hopes to have another branch and dreams to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials needed in his barber shop.

loans.name: Dionelyn

texts.en:
Dionelyn works hard to support her family. Dionelyn is single and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Dionelyn requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Dionelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Dionelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather for making shoe uppers

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Juston is in his early 30s, married, and has one daughter who attends school.  He has been using his loans to operate his photography business since 2000. He works from 6.00 AM to midnight if he is photographing a wedding or other ceremony.  He earns a small monthly profit.

Juston is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy small items such as long cables and a better camera stand and to replace any item which are spoiled.  He used the previous loans to buy a new and up-to-date camera. He used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.   

Juston will share this loan with his loan group "Mawela," which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase long cables and a better camera stand.

loans.name: Umer

texts.en: Umer is a 29-year-old enterprising man who has been running a shoe shop for 5 years. He has been selling quality shoes at a very reasonable rate due to which his sales are increasing day by day. He has 3 children and a wife. Umer has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Umer would be able to expand his business. He would purchase new varieties of quality shoes to offer to his customers. This would increase his sales and net income. As they are living in a rented house Umer would purchase his own house with the profits. Umer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new variety of shoes

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad,  habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla,  ubicado a la orilla del mar caribe. Ella se dedica a generar ingresos,  mediante la  venta de mercancía variada que exhibe en el catalogo, ofrecido por la empresa a la cual está adscrita. Su oferta la conforman artículos de perfumería, cosméticos y de aseo personal, la cual vende a su clientela, mediante créditos a corto plazo y también de contado. Los principales clientes de Rosa, son sus vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores aledaños, que le han referido sus más leales compradores. Su meta es organizar un local, para establecer su punto de ventas y ofrecer de todo un poco, de lo que su clientela requiere, para generar  mayores ingresos y más adelante  ahorrar poder remodelar su casa,  como es su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara colonias, perfumería productos de higiene personal entre otros, que son los artículos que le ofrecen un margen de utilidad permanente pues rotan fácilmente.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 and lives in a municipality close to the city of Barranquilla, located on the shores of the Caribbean ocean. She makes an income from selling products from a catalogue from a company to whom she subscribes. Her inventory includes perfume items, cosmetics, and personal care products. She sells these items to her clients on short-term credit and also for cash. Her main customers are her neighbours and residents of the surrounding areas, who have referred her most loyal buyers to her. Her goal is to have a store in order to establish a sales point, and to offer a bit of everything that her customers require in order to generate more income. She would like to save up to remodel her home, which is her dream. She is applying for a loan on Kiva, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy cologne, perfume, and personal care products. These items offer a good utility margin because they sell frequently.

loans.use: to buy cologne, perfume, and other products.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of 4 hard-working women. Annet is 22 and lives in the town of Luwero in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and aged parents). She has a pub and has been in this business for ten years. 
She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and spirits. She works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked pub and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and spirits

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children who still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha has operated a foodmaking business, making things like beans, chapati (flat bread), dumplings and tea for sale to passersby and neighbors. With the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans and tea leaves for preparation of the meals. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans and tea leaves for preparation of the meals

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a 32-year-old married woman from Jagna, Bohol, and a mother of six children. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Karen works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

Karen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Karen dreams of a sustainable venture and livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has 2 children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as clothes, shoes and bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and bags

loans.name: Editha Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Editha sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida solo se dedica a esta actividad cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos por mayor, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de de un frizer para mantener sus alimentos bien conservados, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Editha is continuing with her food sales business. This is her only job. She tells us that her previous loan went well and she used it to buy supplies wholesale. Her business grew and her clientele expanded; her income increased as a result. She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of a freezer to preserve her food. She is happy and grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maycol Jose

texts.es:
MAYCOL tiene 18 años de edad es soltero no tiene cargas familiares, vive con la hermana en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

MAYCOL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cerdos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar dos cerdos, polvillo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar los cerdos para criarlos y venderlos.  La compra lo realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y la pérdida de materiales.

El sueño es tener un buen progreso y tener bienes. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer mucho.
texts.en:
Maycol is 18, single, and does not have responsibility for a family. He lives with his sister in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.
He works in agriculture, sowing corn and potato, and also raises chickens and hogs.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of hogs and rice-based animal feed. With the help of this loan, he will be able to increase his number of animals to raise and sell. He will make his purchase in the city of Guaranda. His challenges are competition and the loss of materials.
Maycol's dream is to have good progress and to have property. In his free time he likes to read a lot.

loans.use: to buy hogs and rice-based animal feed.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años de edad y esta casada con Mauro, posee una vivienda hecha de adobe donde vive junto a sus 6 hijos formando así una gran familia. Antonia posee terrenos de cultivo a las afueras de su localidad en donde cultiva cacao orgánico.Se inicio en esta labor hace más de 20 años porque la agricultura fue su única opción para ganar dinero y mantener a su familia.Como creció en el campo aprendió lo necesario para obtener frutos de calidad usando abono orgánico y realizando un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones.Parte del terreno para cultivo que tiene se lo cedieron sus padres y con el paso de los años logró ampliarlo comprando las parcelas vecinas. Al tener un mejor espacio para cultivar necesitaba también más dinero para comprar plantas de cacao y otros el cual hizo posible con sus ahorros.Comenta que siempre es necesario tener dinero para cubrir otras necesidades como son el retiro de maleza y la cosecha de los frutos por eso debe de contratar a trabajadores del lugar.Quiere en el futuro adquirir un vehiculo para llevar sus productos desde sus terrenos de cultivo hasta su localidad porque actualmente los transportistas particulares le cobran precios muy altos por el servicio de transporte, otro de sus objetivos es mejorar su vivienda construyéndola a base de adobe.Este es su tercer préstamo con KIVA razón por la cual agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para cumplir sus objetivos laborales.En está oportunidad requiere contar con S/.1,000 soles para comprar abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Antonia, 48, is married to Mauro.  She has an adobe house where she lives with her six children thus forming a big family.  

Antonia owns farmland outside the location where she lives where she grows organic cocoa beans.  She started in this business more than 20 years ago because agriculture was her only option for earning money to support her family.  Since she’d grown up in the countryside she’d learned what was necessary to grow quality fruit using organic manure and providing adequate care to her crops.  

Part of the land she grows on was passed down to her by her parents and as time passed she’s managed to enlarge it by buying neighboring parcels.  Having more land to cultivate means she needs more money too to buy cocoa bean plants and others which she was able to do using her savings.  She comments that it’s always necessary to have money to cover other needs like weed removal and gathering the beans for which she must hire local laborers.  

In future, she’d like to acquire a vehicle to transport her products from her farmland to her place of residence because private transportation providers charge very high prices for transportation services.  Another of her objectives is to make home improvements; she wants to build it with adobe.  

This is her third Kiva loan which is the reason why she’s grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to reach her work goals.  On this occasion, she’d like to have 1,000 soles to buy organic manure for her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Sear

texts.en: A rural farmer from Takeo province’s Trang district, Sear is married and blessed with five children. Currently, only two children still count on her as they are still in school. She grows rice with support from her husband. She has been engaged in her current business for a long time and earns about 24,500 KHR per day. This is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past business loan helped her to gradually increase her business. She earned a decent income to deal with the daily cost of living as well as to keep her children in school. Her daughter wants to pursue her bachelor's degree in accounting, and it is a financial challenge for her. To tackle this challenge, she has applied for an education loan in order to pay her daughter's tuition. She hopes that this loan will provide financial assistance so that her daughter can pay attention to her studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Oeuy

texts.en:
Oeuy is 56 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their own home, which is located in Siem Reap province. Oeuy, together with her husband, has been farming rice and planting cassava for over 30 years. These businesses are deemed to be their main source of income to support the whole family. 

Oeuy is now on her second loan cycle with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her business well. Oeuy is taking the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land. She hopes this loan will allow her to make more profit and her family can live in a better condition in which they can get what they need.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Sitha is 32 years old and married with four children living in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng province’s Sa Ang district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on one-hectare area of farmland, which they have been doing for ten years. Sitha supplements the family's income by selling vegetables in the local area. The current business earns them about 12,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 5,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sitha’s group consists of four members who live in the same village, and she is a first cycled client with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Sitha is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use so as to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a decent latrine

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Dinah works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling salt in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from tailoring and fish-vending businesses. Dinah is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy sacks and other paraphernalia for her salt-making business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks and other paraphernalia for her salt-making business.

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the "Takuru" group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Hassan is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a trader and they have 3 children. Hassan has been a businessman for many years now, he sells used clothes. With his share of this loan, he will buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Ingrid Elena

texts.es: Ingrid desde hace once años, emprendió su experiencia comercial, vendiendo artículos a crédito  como jeans, camisas, blusas, perfumes, calzado y cosmético y alquilando sillas para eventos, directamente a sus clientes. Ella la impulsó la necesidad de generar  ingresos y apoyar a  su esposo en la financiación de los gastos de su hogar, en el cual existe un hijo de 2 años de edad,  con quien sueñan ver crecer sano y exitoso y para ello este hogar se prepara. Su meta de aumentar el capital de trabajo no se detiene, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa femenina e informal, calzado y cosméticos, que tiene encargado por sus clientes, quienes son sus amigos, vecinos y referidos por estos.  Con sus anteriores  financiamientos ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y con ello la utilidad de su negocio; hoy Ingrid compra a mayoristas con los que negocia buenos descuentos, por volumen y por compras de contado; su meta mas adelante es ubicar su almacén en un punto comercial, para aumentar sus posibilidades de ser exitosa y lograr sus sueños de prosperidad, que no son otros que los de ahorrar y adquirir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Ingrid became a businessperson. She started selling items such as jeans, blouses, perfumes, footwear, and cosmetics on credit. She also started renting out chairs directly to her clients for events. She was motivated by the necessity of generating an income and supporting her husband with the household costs. They have one two-year-old. They dream of seeing him grow up to be healthy and successful, and they are preparing for this.
Her goal is to increase her working capital, and she will achieve it; so she is applying for a loan on Kiva, her third loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy informal women's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, which her customers have ordered. Her customers are her friends and neighbours, and people who have been referred to her by her friends and neighbours.
With her previous loans she has been able to increase her sales and her business' profit. Today, Ingrid buys from wholesalers and is able to negotiate good discounts for buying large volumes and in cash. Her goal for the future is to have a store in a shopping centre in order to increase her chances of being successful and reaching her dreams of prosperity; she wants to save up and buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy women's informal clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus padres y una hermana, ella posee una venta de maletines, carteras y bolsones tiene de diferentes estilos,  los productos que comercia es de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; la clienta es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante, quiere acrecentar su negocio es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos en variedad y estilos. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
This client lives in her own home with her parents and one sister. She has a small shop selling different styles of handbags, wallets and cases. The products she sells are of a very good quality and the prices are affordable. This is why a high number of customers have purchased from her recently. This client is very active; she is always working to get ahead.

She wants to grow her business, and for this reason she decided to request a loan from Integral. With this loan she can buy a wide variety of products and styles. She will then be able to meet her customers’ needs. She hopes that this will enable her to provide her family with economic security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy different styles of wallets, handbags and cases

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena, 31 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa  desde hace 10 años. Negocio que inicio cuando recibió una charla sobre ventas por catálogo de cosméticos poco a poco fue consiguiendo sus propios ingresos, agrego venta de perfumes y actualmente vende ropa también. Durante el mes d mayo es una excelente temporada de venta de ropa y cosméticos pues se celebra el mes de las madres y la búsqueda de obsequios es contante y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender sus productos. Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar perfumes, ropa y cosméticos. Su meta es logra tener una tienda de artículos de uso personal variados ofreciendo diferentes marcas accesible para todo publico.
texts.en:
Lorena is 31 years old, and from the city of Managua.  A vendor by trade, she has been selling cosmetics and clothing for 10 years. She started this business when she heard a talk about selling cosmetics by catalog, and little by little began getting her own income. She added the sale of perfume, and currently sells clothing also. 

The month of May is an excellent season for selling clothing and cosmetics, as Mother's Month is celebrated.  People are in constant search of gifts, and she doesn't want to miss the chance to sell her products. She is needing the loan to buy perfumes, clothing and cosmetics. Her goal is to succeed in owning a store selling a variety of personal products, offering various brands and making them accesible to everyone.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marlene, de 47 años de edad, de oficio comerciante es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, tiene 3 hijos de 17,21 y 28 años de edad. Inicio con su negocio vendiendo tortillas luego agrego la venta de cuajadas y queso. Así fue consiguiendo capital para agregar otros productos y logro formar su mini pulpería. Sus hijos y su esposo la ayudan atender el negocio, pero la mayor parte del tiempo es ella quien dirige la pulpería. Su esposo aporta en el hogar con lo que gana como taxista. De esta manera sacan adelante a su familia. 
Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, galletas, frijoles, leña, huevos etc. Este financiamiento le permitirá surtir más su negocio con mejores productos y ofrecer variedad a su clientela. Su expectativa es tener su pulpería en una mejor infraestructura y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene, 47, is a merchant; she owns a small grocery store.  She has three children aged 17, 21 and 28 years.  She started the business selling tortillas and then added cheeses.  She gradually earned capital this way in order to add other products and eventually formed her small grocery store.  Her children and husband help her tend to the business but most of the time it’s she who runs the store.  Her husband contributes to the household with what he earns as a taxi driver; they support their family this way.

Today, she’s asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cookies, firewood, eggs, etc.  This financing will make it possible for her to better stock her store with better products and to offer variety to her customers.  Her expectation is to have better infrastructure for her store and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Muy's Group

texts.en:
A 48-year-old mother residing in Battambang Province’s Bovel district, Muoy is married and blessed with seven children. Nowadays, six children still count on her as four of them are still in school while a remaining two are too young for schooling.  

She plants corn on two hectares as the main source of income while her husband is a house builder. She has been involved in the current business for six years, earning about 26,000 KHR per day. 

Muoy is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the leader. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,500,000 KHR each, while a remaining member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy seed plus potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her living status in a gradual manner and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy seed and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Narin is 52 years old and blessed with four children. Currently, only one son is still dependent on her and is still in school. Narin manages a three-hectare area for cassava growing in order to sustain her family. With 22 years of experience in her current business, she is able to earn up to 36,000 KHR per day. 

Narin has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles. She has fully repaid the previous loans and successfully improved her living conditions and she can afford decent food for her family. Now, she is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash for her cassava. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop productivity and triple her yield as compared with last year.

loans.use: To buy potash for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos y joyas por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Rosmery is continuing to sell cosmetics and jewelry. She says that her previous loan went well, since she used it for the wholesale purchase of cosmetics that were on sale. She says that this was good and her business and clientele grew; as a result, her income increased. She is now requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of cosmetics and jewelry in order to keep increasing her working capital. She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Calixtro

texts.es: Calixto de 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa. Él se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años y  es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona. Don Calixto ha decidido solicitar un crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.  Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia. Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Calixto is 54 years old and lives with his wife in a home if his own.  He is a farmer and has been raising corn and beans for several years and this is how he earns his daily bread.  He is a hardworking, responsible man, well known in the zone.  Calixto has decided to ask for a loan so that he can buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc.  What he wants most is for his harvest to be abundant and better than the previous ones since this is how he supports her family.  He trusts in God and through his own dedication and effort in his work, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Pier Alexander

texts.es:
Pier es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Pier no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cordero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pier trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una puerta, la cual desea instalar en el cuarto de sus padres, ya que actualmente solo cuentan con una cortina y al acercarse la época de invierno, Pier desea brindar un poco mas de seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Pier’s a 20-year-old, single man living in the city of Cañete in Imperial District with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start work to help his parents, Pier has been unable to study the professional career of Mechanics he wishes.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks a delicious lamb stew to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Pier works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks he does well because of the good way he does his work and because of the kind way he treats others.

Pier is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a door that he wants to install in his parents’ bedroom because they currently just have a curtain and winter is approaching.  Pier would like to provide a little more security and well-being for his family while he will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to be able to study a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a door.

loans.name: Santa Maria De 6 Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por da a sus hijos todo lo que ellas no han podido tener, desean crecer y demostrar que trabajando se puede salir adelante.
Maximina es artesana en barro y cuenta que tiene mucha habilidad, su clientela siempre compra de ella sus novedades ya que son muy lindas y finas. Ella comenta que su sueño es que sus obras sean conocidas en todos lados y de esa forma también poder expandir lo que tiene el país.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla para seguir haciendo sus artesanías y seguir también procurando el ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
The fifteen members of this committee are all female heads of household who strive to give their children everything they never had; they want to grow and show that by working one can get ahead.

Maximina says that she's a very skilled artisan who makes clay crafts.  Her clientele always buys her novelty items from her because they are very pretty and fine.  She comments that her dream is that her creations become known everywhere so that she can expand what she makes throughout the country.

She’s requesting this loan to buy clay so that she can continue making her crafts and continue to earn family income.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, originally from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is 46 years old and blessed with four dependent children who attend the local state school. He has a half-hectare area for growing rice to support daily food consumption. To earn more income, he also catches fish to sell. The current business, which he has been involved in for 24 years, returns him about 10,000 KHR per day. 

Phat, a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, is the leader of a group requesting a loan. Phat will use his loan portion to buy fishing materials necessary to support his business. He hopes that he can improve his family’s status and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials necessary to support his business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Lourdes has been pig fattening for 24 years and earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy, single and age 27, is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as the main source of her family’s income. For the seven years that she has been with this business, she has been able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she now leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group's requested loan is 5,000,000 KHR. Sophy, whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will help her to replant her crops on time and get back a good yield with high income.

loans.use: To plow her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Kampong Cham province is where rice cultivation and cassava planting are the common businesses in the area. Rom is a farmer who grows those products in order to earn a living in order to support her family, especially her one little kid. The current business has returned her about 17,800 KHR per day. 

Rom is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She now leads a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,200,000 KHR. Rom will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash and to plow her farmland. She hopes to make triple income so that she can set aside some money in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash and plow her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother from Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Sarin is 65 years old and has two children who currently have their own jobs already. She supports her living via rice farming and snack selling. 

Sarin has engaged in the current business about five years. With this new loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan. The past loans have enabled her to relieve her family’s burden better than before. 

Now, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed for growing and ingredients to make snacks for resale. She hopes to increase her profit to a high level to better her living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for growing and ingredients to make snacks for resale.

loans.name: Orieta

texts.es: Orieta de 54 años de edad,  habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, cuando una amiga le sugirió hacerlo, desde su propia casa; poco a poco su negocio creció y fue agregando nuevos productos, porque fue acogida inmediatamente. Ella hoy vende directamente a su clientela,  que son sus vecinos y referidos, en la modalidad de crédito y de contado y en un horario que inicia,  desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza en el mercado público, donde hay proveedores que  ofrecen estos productos muy frescos. Las metas asociadas con el negocio son las de independizarlo de su espacio familiar  y mas adelante remodelar su vivienda, la quiere encontrar  mayor  sosiego e incrementar sus ventas,  para poder ahorrar y mejorara su bienestar cada vez mas.. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará 1 enfriador nuevo, frutas tropicales y verduras, en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos especiales y hacer que  la inversión de su credikiva sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Orieta, age 54, lives in the city of Barranquilla and has sold fruits and vegetables for five years. She started her business after a friend suggested it to her, and she runs it out of her home. Bit by bit, her business grew and she started selling new products because they sold immediately. She now sells directly to her customers, who are her neighbours and people who have been referred to her. She sells on credit or for cash. She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. She makes her purchases in the public market where there are suppliers who sell the produce very fresh.
Orieta's business goals include moving the business out of her family's space and later remodeling her home. She wants to have more serenity in her business and to increase her sales in order to save up and improve her well-being. She is applying for a loan with which she will buy a new freezer, as well as tropical fruits and vegetables in a larger quantity in order to obtain special discounts. This will make her loan a success.

loans.use: to buy a new cooler, as well as tropical fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 5to del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es un medio de conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir, que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo superar su línea de pobreza, ahora su desafío es poder mantenerse, lo cual podrá hacer con mucho trabajo. Ella cuenta que se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, en ella trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y es por medio de este trabajo que da y ayuda a su familia con lo que puede.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, verduras, carnes, productos y granel y demás, y así poder surtir su local para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called “Niño Jesús” (Child Jesus) is in its fifth cycle in the women’s committee program; they are currently filling out the poverty elimination survey which is the way of knowing each one of their situations.

One of the members is Ana.  In her previous survey her level of poverty was level three, that is, thanks to her effort she was able to improve her level of poverty.  Now, her challenge is to be able to support herself which she will be able to do with much work.  She relates that she works in sales since she has a small, well-stocked grocery store.  She works every day from very early on and it’s by means of this work that she helps her family with everything she can.

She’s requesting this loan to buy beverages, vegetables, meats, products, bulk items, and others to be able to stock her store to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 35 años de edad y esta casada con Demetrio y vive junto a sus 4 hijos en una casa hecha a base de adobe. Alejandra se dedica  a la agricultura en un terreno de cultivo de 4 hectáreas desde hace 14 años con el apoyo de su esposo.Desde niña sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar los productos rentables de la zona como el cacao orgánico, café y otros por eso cuando cumplió 20 años sus padres le regalaron un terreno pequeño para trabajar independientemente.Con el paso de los años y las ganancias que fue obteniendo  expandió progresivamente el área de su terreno agrícola para mejorar sus ingresos, sin embargo al tener mas plantaciones se vio en la necesidad de contratar a trabajadores del lugar quienes hasta la actualidad la apoyan en diversas tareas agrícolas con la finalidad de que sus productos  sean de buena calidad para venderlos en los mercados y así recuperar el dinero que invirtió en las cosechas .Para mejorar la calidad de sus productos usa abono orgánico porque considera que los abonos químicos deterioran la calidad de los terrenos agrícolas.Desea seguir con su labor para ahorrar dinero y  empezar a construir su vivienda a base de material noble.Este es el tercer préstamo que recibe por parte de KIVA y agradece la confianza que le brindan porque considera que el dinero recibido le permite solventar diversas necesidades propios de su labor.Con el monto solicitado de S/. 1000 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 35 and married to Demetrio. They live together with their four children in a home made of adobe. For 14 years, Alejandra has worked in agriculture with her husband's support, on a plot of land which measures 4 hectares. Her parents taught her to cultivate profitable local products, such as organic cocoa and coffee, when she was a child. When she turned 20, her parents gave her a small plot of land so that she could work independently.
With the passing of time, she used her income to progressively expand her agricultural land in order to increase her income. However, once she had a lot of land she realized that she needed to hire labourers. They now help her with her work so that her product can be of good quality for sale in the markets. This will allow her to recuperate the money she invests in the crops.
In order to improve the quality of her products, she uses organic fertilizer because she thinks that chemical fertilizers are detrimental to the quality of the land. She wants to continue with her work in order to save money and start to build her home out of a better material. This is her third loan on Kiva and she is grateful for the confidence that is placed in her. This money allows her to cover various necessities in her work. With the requested 1000 soles, she will buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Porvenir 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Porvenir II está en su 14 ciclo, el grupo lleva ese nombre, ya que las miembros están en busca del porvenir de sus familias, de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, donde 12 de están con un ingreso muy bajo.
Miguela  es parte de este grupo, ella es una de las que tiene un ingreso muy bajo, pero igual, pese a ello se esfuerza y quiere mejorar su economía. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, para infusiones, como ser te, mate y terere (bebidas tradicionales paraguayas) y con esto se sacrifica para dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella desea que el día de mañana su familia no tenga que pasar por necesidades, es por eso que se está esforzando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta y de esa forma seguir con su emprendimiento y tener los medios para ayudar a su familia y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
The “Porvenir II” (Time To Come II) group is in its 14th cycle.  The group is so named because the members are seeking a future for their families, to be able to grow and improve their lives.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey that allows them to know each of their situations; 12 of them are of very low income.

Miguela is part of this group; she’s one who is of very low income.  However, despite that she strives and wants to improve her economy.  She works selling natural remedies used in infusions like tea, 'mate' and ‘terere’ (traditional Paraguayan beverages) and this is how she sacrifices to give her family what they need.  She hopes that someday in the future her family will not have to go through any more hard times and this is why she’s making the effort.

She’s requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to sell to continue with her enterprise and to have the means by which she can help her family and to improve her economy.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to resell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Jagna, Bohol. She is engaged in a business selling food like ice candy and other refreshments. Ice candy is a typical Filipino delicacy/refreshment made of milk, sugar and fruits. This is a big hit especially during the summer season.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for making ice candy like milk and sugar, wrappers and other supplies. With this loan, she will be able to make more ice candy and sell more, thus, augmenting her sales and income. Imelda dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making ice candy like milk and sugar, wrappers and other supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). The previous loan enabled her to double her monthly income, which has been of great help to her family. With the new loan, she wants to buy food products such as beans, rice, wheat, fruits, and vegetables for resale to expand her existing business and earn more income from the business.

loans.use: to buy food products such as beans, rice, wheat, fruits, and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia operates sari-sari or variety store business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy soda, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soap, and detergents. This loan will enable her to increase her stocks and sell more to her customers. In the future, Delia dreams of expanding her store so that it can generate more revenue.

loans.use: to Purchase soda, beverages, canned goods, noodles, soap, and detergents.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta, a married mother of one, has a shop to generate income for her family. Now requesting her first loan of $600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), she will buy some additional supplies to sell such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. Marta is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags for her shop

loans.name: Guillermina Olga

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 65 años es casada con 4 hijos independientes se dedica a la repostería para luego venderlas ambulatoriamente. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de comida y jugos a pedido de sus clientes. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza ESIKA.  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos insumos de repostería, licuadora, batidora, extractora. Su mayor deseo es tener un stand propio donde pueda vender las reposterías que prepara. Guillermina agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo adquirido.
texts.en: Guillermina is 65, married, and has four independent children. She makes pastries and sells them door-to-door. Many years ago she sold food and juice on order. In her free time she sells Esika beauty products. She will invest this loan in the purchase of new supplies for making pastries; a blender and a mixer. Her greatest wish is to have her own stand to sell her pastries. Guillermina thanks the Kiva lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a blender and a mixer for making pastries.

loans.name: Rincon Poty 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño está en su 3 ciclo del programa de comité de Jóvenes Emprendedores, donde ellos como jóvenes quieren tomar en sus manos las riendas y poder luchar por salir adelante y también sentirse útiles ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es Delia, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de Belleza Avon, cuenta que por medio de este trabajo quiere ayudar a su familia, aportar con un granito de arena para aligerar la carga de su familia. Ella quiere el día de mañana ser una gran microempresaria y poder seguir creciendo así.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos Avon, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Divino Niño" or "Divine Child" is in its 3rd program cycle of the "comité de Jóvenes Emprendedores" or "Committee of Young Entrepreneurs" where they as young people want to take the reins and to fight to get ahead and feel useful helping their families.
One of the members is Delia, who sells Avon beauty products for a living. She says that by way of work she wants to help her family, contributing with a grain of sand to lighten the load for her family. In the future she wants to be a small business owner and be able to continue growing.
She is requesting this loan to purchase Avon products, and in that way be able to continue growing and fulfilling customer orders. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Maria Auxiliadora” con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo está en su ciclo número tercer del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
La Sra. Cristina, presidenta del comité, es una mujer luchadora e innovadora, promueve actividades y reuniones con las integrantes, para que así puedan mejorar la relación del grupo. Ella se dedica a la peluquería, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien porque siempre hace muy buenos trabajos a sus clientes. Ella sueña con poder ir creciendo y mejorando cada vez más su negocio. Ella lucha y quiere ser la mejor.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, gel, spray y demás para poder seguir ofreciendo una buena atención a sus clientes y clientas.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” group with much effort and work is in its third cycle in the women’s committee program; all of them work and help each other to get ahead.

Cristina, committee president, is a hardworking, innovative woman.  She promotes activities and group meetings so that group relations can improve.  She’s a hair stylist and relates that she’s doing well because she always does good work for her customers.  She dreams with being able to grow and improve more in her business every day.  She strives and wants to be the best.

She’s requesting this loan to buy hair color, shampoo, rinses, creams, gels, spray and others to continue providing good service to her female and male customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es mecánico de motocicletas, vive  en casa familiar en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Julian requiere el credito para la compra de material de construcción, pues refaccionará su baño y cocina; comprará ladrillos, cemento, fierros y de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia
El sueño de Julian es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Julian is a motorcycle mechanic. He lives in a family house that is made of brick and has cement floors. The house is located in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He works more than eight hours a day since this is the only way for him to support his family.

Julian is requesting a loan so that he can buy construction materials for repairing the bathroom and the kitchen. He will buy bricks, cement, and iron bars. This will enable him to improve his family’s quality of life.

Julian dreams of finishing the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and iron bars for repairing the bathroom and the kitchen.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is married to a businessman and together they have six children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Mwanaharusi has operated a charcoal business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites theft and the high cost of transportation as her major challenges in the business.

Mwanaharusi is requesting a 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su 4 ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están ayudándose para poder salir adelante e ir creciendo en los emprendimientos que cada una tiene. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una, donde 4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas,  la Sra. Dorila se encuentra en el nivel uno, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos, pero de igual manera, ella se esfuerza por poder seguir creciendo y por medio de ese esfuerzo mejorar su condición económica. Ella tiene una despensa, y solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, lácteos, verduras, carne, panificados y productos a granel para seguir con sus ventas y dar a sus clientes lo que piden. Agradece por esta oportunidad que le permitirá seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in its fourth cycle in the women’s committee program.  All of them help each other out in order to get ahead and so each can grow in her own enterprise.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey in order to know each of their situation; four of them are below the poverty line.

One of these is Dorila who is in level one, that is to say, very low income.  However, she strives to continue growing and by means of this effort to improve her economic situation.  

She has grocery store and is requesting this loan to buy stock merchandise like beverages, dairy products, vegetables, meats, baked gods and bulk items for it to continue selling and giving her customers what they ask for.  She is grateful for this opportunity that will allow her to continue growing in her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nancy Beatriz

texts.es:
NANCY tiene 50 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y el esposo en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Nancy tiene un puesto de comida. Solicita el crédito para comprar un quintal de arroz, azúcar, cebolla, carnes, embutidos, ollas grandes, una cosina industrial.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para trabajar. La compra la realizará en Chimbo. El sueño es que el hijo termine los estudios. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el trabajar mucho para tener muchos ingresos.En el tiempo libre le gusta tener actividad que hacer.
texts.en:
Nancy, 50, is married and has a son; she lives with her son and husband in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.  Nancy has a food stand.  She’s requesting the loan to buy a quintal of rice, sugar, onions, meats, cured meats, large pots and an industrial stove.

With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy everything she needs to work.  She will make her purchase in Chimbo.  Her dream is that her son completes his schooling.  The challenge she faces is to work hard to earn high income.  She likes to have things to do in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of rice, sugar, onions, meats, cured meats, large pots and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Mohsin

texts.en:
Mohsin is a 37-year-old married man. He is employed in an education office and earns a small salary, which is not quite enough to cover all his needs. He lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is requesting a loan of 330,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer him comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house.

loans.name: Moada

texts.en: Moada is a 21-year-old married woman and has one child. She is uneducated and is living in a poor area in Haja, Yemen. Her house is very old and in a miserable situation. She has accumulated some money to renovate her house. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that after the completion of house renovation, she will start accumulating money to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years, and she earns additional income by farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional feeds for her pigs.  Ma. Theresa is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rebaz

texts.en:
Rebaz is a 24-year-old Iraqi man. He is single and lives with his family, whom he helps to support with his income.

Rebaz is currently running a small local fast food restaurant, which has been in business for 12 years now. The little shop makes the locally popular sandwiches, and Rebaz would like to continue to provide his clients with the good quality items they have become accustomed to. At the same time, to ensure the small shop continues to meet the standards prescribed by local regulations, Rebaz would like to renovate the shop and renew the work area. To be able to pay for the improvement works, Rebaz took out a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Rebaz is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and renew the work area

loans.name: Al-Dhakra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Dhakra and is made up of five women who live in Hadramout, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB.

Dhakra is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. She is working hard to cover her family's expenses. She has a small house which is very old and needs a quick renovation. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 YER, which she will use to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that after the completion of the renovation she will feel safe in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house.

loans.name: Sunaati

texts.en: Sunaati, now married, has successfully paid off his previous loan as his farming business is doing well. He has managed to add on to his livestock numbers from the proceeds of the farm produce. He is now servicing his third loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings which he will use to prepare the land for farming and to buy farm inputs. He will used the increased proceeds to buy more livestock for fattening and resale. His hope is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Esmeralda has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.  She requested a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, bread, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, bread, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Edinson, de 42 años de edad es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Marleny y sus 2 hijas a las  que cuida en la cada que compró hace 20 años.  Su principal actividad económica es el trasporte público, mientras que su esposa se dedica a los trabajos del campo y en sus tiempos libres la ayuda. Afirma que hace poco adquirió su propio carro con lo ahorros de toda su vida, esto lo ayudó a inscribirse a una empresa de trasporte, donde comenzó a trabajar con mucha dedicación.  “Durante este tiempo me fue muy bien pues ya soy conocido, además no hay movilidad en esta zona”, afirma.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará llantas para su carro,
texts.en:
Edinson, 42, is a hardworking man.  He lives with his wife, Marleny, and their two daughters who he cares for in the house he bought 20 years ago.  His main economic activity is public transport while his wife works in the fields; he helps her out in his spare time.

He states that he bought a car of his own a short time ago using his lifetime’s savings.  This helped him to join a transportation firm where he’s begun to work with much dedication.  “I've done well during this time because I’m well-known and in addition there’s no car in this zone,” he affirms.  

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels happy because he’ll have the necessary capital to improve his business and thus his quality of life.  He will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Jum'anazar

texts.ru:
Чумъаназар житель Спитаменского района. Ему 46 лет. Он женатый мужчина. Чумъаназар является отцом пятерых детей. У него трое сыновей и две дочери. Его жена занимается вышиванием женской одежды. Старший и младший сын работают вместе с отцом в цехе. 
У Чумъаназар среднее техническое образование. Он занимается производством и продажей железных ворот. Он является опытным сварщиком. Чумъаназар занимается этим делом уже более восьми лет. Кредит запрашивает для закупа сырья для производства железных ворот.
texts.en:
Jum'anazar is a resident of the Spitamen region. He is 46 years old. He is a married man. Jum'anazar is the father of five children. He has three sons and two daughters. His wife is embroidering women's clothing. His elder and younger sons are working with him in the shop.

Jum'anazar has secondary technical education. He is engaged in the manufacturing and sale of iron gates. He is an experienced welder. Jum'anazar has been engaged in this business for more than eight years. Jum'anazar requests this loan for the purchase of raw materials for the production of iron gates.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the production of iron gates

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. 

Lorena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

NWTF is presenting Lorena's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad.

loans.name: Elixanio

texts.es: Elixiano se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años cuando la cosecha a pasado trabaja de jornal y corta de café en una finca que esta cerca de su casa,  es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus familia vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad en casa propia, elixanio  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, etc.  y herramientas para su cultivo de maíz. Y frijol y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elixiano has been growing corn and beans for several years. Once the harvest has passed, he works as a laborer by pruning coffee plants on a farm near his house. Elixiano is a hardworking person who is very responsible with his household obligations. He has always been known for providing the best for his family. Elixiano lives in his own home with his wife and three-year-old son.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers, seeds, compost, other supplies, and tools so that he can plant corn and beans. This will enable him to generate more income so that he can provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, compost, other supplies, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Qahramon

texts.ru: Кахрамон родился в 1977 году в сельской местности, в семье агронома. Его отец бывший агроном в местном колхозе, а мама работала там колхозником. С утра до вечера, без выходных его родители работали на полях. Маленький Кахрамон смотря на все это, и еще в девстве мечтал что будет как свой отец работать в колхозе. Ведь несмотря на бедность и финансовые затруднение они были счастливы. Сейчас Кахрамон женат и имеет двоих детей. В течении четырех лет он занимается разведением крупного и мелко- рогатого скота. Параллельно с этим он еще работает в колхозе. Его жена помогает ему, она продает из дома кисломолочные продукты собственного производства. Так как его семья увеличивается и потребность растет, он хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого он обратился в МДО Арванд. Он хочет купить одну дойную корову.
texts.en:
Qahramon was born in 1977 in the countryside, the son of an agronomist.  His father used to work as an agronomist at a local kolkhoz (collective farm), and his mother also worked there as a farmer.  His parents used to work in the fields from morning until the evening, seven days a week.  As a child, Qahramon saw all that, and dreamed about working on a farm one day, like his father, because even though the family was poor and faced financial hardship, they were also happy. 

Qahramon is now married and he has two children.  For the past four years he has been involved in raising cattle and smaller livestock.  In addition to this activity, he also works on a farm.  His wife helps him by producing and selling her own dairy products at home.

With a growing family and more needs to meet, Qahramon would like to increase his business.  This is why he has turned to MDO Arvand to purchase an additional dairy cow.

loans.use: to increase his headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Kibriyo
