El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas para darle mantenimiento  a un área de tres manzanas de café. El estima que este crédito le ayudara a levantar sus rendimientos de producción, porque le dará un buen manejo agronómico a su cultivo. Sus planes futuros son comprar un terreno para cultivar más café orgánico y comprar materiales y equipos agrícolas. Sus metas próximas son incrementar los rendimientos de su próxima cosecha en el ciclo 2013 - 2014.
texts.en:
Donis is from Santa Rosa, a small region on the outskirts of Estelí.  He is married and has four children who are 13, 12, 8, and 2 years old, three of whom are in school.  He started his business growing coffee ten years ago when he was 28 years old and his mother left him some land with about 5.2 acres of cultivated coffee fields.  From then one he has been growing and harvesting coffee, using his profits to buy more land to expand his plantings.  He also grows corn, beans, tomatoes, and sweet peppers.  His wife helps him with his work.  He sells his produce locally to street vendors.  He has another source of income, which is from his wife's small grocery store.  He would like to sell his produce in the capital of Managua because they pay better prices there for coffee, corn, beans, tomatoes, and sweet peppers.  The goals he has for his business are to have good yields on his crops and to get good prices when he sells. 

He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, and fungicides to treat an area of about 5.2 acres of coffee.  He expects this loan will help him increase his production because it will be a good agricultural treatment for his crops.  His plans for the future are to buy land to grow more organic coffee and to buy materials and farming equipment.  His short-term goals are to increase his yield from the upcoming 2013-4 harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and fungicide to treat an area of about 5.2 acres of coffee

loans.name: Otra Oportunidad Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Tania es una mujer acompañada, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida, gaseosas desde hace cuatro años que se dedica a esa actividad, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, de estar en la institución tiene una año. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, plátanos verdes, plátanos maduros, leñas, gaseosas variados sabores etc. Scarleth tiene 21 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Jeannette tiene 30 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo y venta de comida los fines de semanas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three owners of small businesses, one of whom is Tania. She is married with two children, ages 19 and 21. She has sold food and pop for four years. Her husband helps her with the business and she has been a member of the institution for one year. She will invest this loan in the purchase of basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, green bananas, ripe bananas, firewood, and a variety of pop. 
Scarleth is 21 and sells used clothing. Jeannette is 30 and raises hogs and sells food on the weekends.

loans.use: to buy basic staples like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, green bananas, ripe bananas, firewood, and a variety of pop.

loans.name: Orencia

texts.en:
Orencia is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in vegetable farming for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

As of now, Orencia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest, because she will be able to plant and grow healthy vegetables. Orencia hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 21-year-old from Yerevan. She studies at the Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture and, in addition to studying, also works as a waiter in one of the local cafes. As Mariam's salary is barely enough for sustaining her family's life (she lives with her parents and sister), it is very difficult for her to save money for her education. She has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition.
This loan is very important for Mariam to complete her education and to find a job within her profession and become financially independent.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 47 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own block house on a plot of land. 

Batbayar has been rendering taxi services to local people using his own automobile for sixteen consecutive years. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly to their destination and shortening routes. Also, during his free time, he does some electric repair work on contract with some individuals and entities. His wife has been doing house interior decoration for a long time and specialized in this service sector. His son studies at university. 

Their old house is made with concrete blocks, and over the years it has deteriorated. So Batbayar is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials to make repairs and an extension to his house. The building materials he will purchase include concrete, bricks, planks, shingles and window frames. The extended and renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual whose dream is to see his son graduate his university successfully and become a white-collar worker, not wanting his son to work like him day and night.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is a 49-year old resident of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. Ruben supports his family needs from the little amount of 7,000 he earns monthly from his garden.  He has been doing this for five years. He joined Kiva partner GDMPC in 2010 and recently requested a loan of 10,000.00 PHP in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He dreams to improve his garden to double their income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 51 years-old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 40 year-old wife Khatuna. Aleksandre has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Khatuna is a dance teacher. She owns a small dance studio and earns a small monthly income which is the only source of income for the family. 

Aleksandre requested a loan from Kiva partner Credo in order to start-up a family business. Aleksandre has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low income. 

With his loan Aleksandre will purchase a car to drive as a taxi. He will serve the locals by providing transport and will earn a small daily income for the family. Aleksandre is a very hard working man and he will work long hours to earn a good profit. The increased income will give him an opportunity to improve the family standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1963. She has a son who is a driver and two daughters.  One has own family and another is learning at university. Her husband is a construction worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Minh grows and sells vegetables. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for a long time. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in Kiva partner SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND in order to buy more vegetable seeds to grow. She always wants to have more money to enlarge her garden of vegetables and raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds to grow.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en: Zaynura is 34 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Zaynura is a person who always tries hard to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 10 years ago. She cares for the cattle at her house where she has a cowshed. Now, she wants to increase the number of cattle. She has requested a loan in the amount of 3000 USD to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing the number of cattle

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 47 year-old vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of six children. Sylvia has had a vegetable farming business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. 

Sylvia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and nylon for a trellis. With this, she will be able to plant more vegetables and harvest good quality crops which she can sell to the market at a good price. Sylvia aims to expand her business so that it will augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and nylon for a trellis.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years-old and blessed with four children aged between fourteen and two years-old. He is a livestock trader in the Bomet area and has been running the business for the past six years.  He makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000

He is borrowing a third loan of KES. 80,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase more livestock to resell.. The anticipated profit will be reinvested in order to boost business. 

His future dream is to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy livestock to trade.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a mechanic based in Bomet town. He is a 30-year-old single gentleman who learnt about KADET LTD from one of his regular customers at the garage.

His first loan of KES. 10,000 will enable him to acquire spare parts and related tools for his repair business. He will use the proceeds to expand his business.

His dream is to buy himself a car.

loans.use: to buy motor spare parts

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de tela, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa, venta de pan, confesión de deportivos, venta de fierros, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys es integrante, ella indica que es el sexto ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia con el primer préstamo que sacó en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
“Claveles” (Carnations) is a Communal Bank that will start its fourteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Gladys. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities, such as selling cosmetics, running a grocery store, selling fabric, selling soft drinks, selling clothes, selling bread, creating sportswear, selling iron and producing macramé blankets.

Gladys is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says this is the sixth cycle she has been working with Pro Mujer, and that she had been invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She is currently running a clothes shop, and she says she has started this activity out of her own initiative tanks to the first loan she has received form Pro Mujer.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying clothes at wholesale price in the fairs of the town of La Paz, to then sell them in her stall. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her household as much as she can, as she is single and she has three children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loan, the seminars and the health program.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su madre y sus 3 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres.Desde que comenzó a trabajar con su asociación, emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de verduras, granos y tubérculos,los cuales son llevados a la ciudad más cercana para su venta. Cuenta que en temporadas de cosecha tiene que aprovechar al máximo, ya que los alimentos cuestan muy poco y ella puede obtener más ganancias. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esta actividad. “Cada vez que obtengo, una carga de alimentos, le mando a mi madre la cantidad de productos necesarios para que comercialice”, afirma. Su trabajo es muy bueno, pues es mayorista y reparte en cantidad a los comerciantes minoristas que llegan a los mercados más grandes del país. Pero sus tiempos libres los distribuye en el cuidado de sus animales.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo durante todo estos años, pues pudo administrar su dinero y volverlo productivo.Lourdes, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de menestras y verduras por toneladas, para invertir en su negocio y abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 31, is a hardworking woman. She lives with and cares for her mother and her three children in her parents' house. 

Since she started to work with her association, she started a business buying and selling vegetables, grains, and tubers, which she brings to the closest city to sell. She says that she has to take maximum advantage of the harvest season, because goods cost very little and she can earn a better profit. She has been in this business for four years. "Every time I receive a load of goods, I send my mother the necessary amount of products so she can sell them," she says. Her work is very good because she is a wholesaler and she distributes to retailers who reach the biggest markets in the country. She spends her free time caring for her animals. 

This is her second Kiva loan. She is grateful for the support during all these years, because she was able to administer her money and make it productive. Lourdes will invest this loan of 4,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of legumes and vegetables by the ton to invest in her business and supply her clients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and legumes by the ton.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is from Gandzaqar village in the Tavush region. He is the father of two children and earns his income by cultivating land. His daughter, Azganush, is a 19-year-old student at the Ijevan branch of the Yerevan State University. Vachagan works hard to earn enough income to sustain his family and save for his daughter's education. Unfortunately the agricultural income is barely enough to make ends meet and, in order to pay Azganush's university tuition, Vachagan has applied for this loan.
This loan is very important for Vachagan and his daughter. He dreams that his children will become skilled specialists and find good jobs.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 40 years old, married and has four children who are in school. He is a farmer from Nakuru.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizer and seeds. He paid his previous loans on time. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to educate his children.

He hopes to buy a motorbike in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 36 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 3 de sus 4 hijos, en la casa que compró hace 2 años. Nilda se dedica a la  venta de productos comestibles . Durante las mañanas abre las puertas de su tienda par atender a los pobladores de la zona, después de unas horas lo cierra y se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas a vender principalmente bebidas gasificadas y jugos. “Es mi ingreso estable, ya que encontré la manera de no dejar de vender, pues los pobladores de mi pueblo, después de las 8 de la mañana, se dirigen a cuidar de sus sembríos, por lo que no están en sus casa, por eso aprovecho esa oportunidad, para seguir vendiendo”, comenta. Ahora ella desea incrementar su capital para vender más alimentos variados.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que le permite seguir avanzado , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nilda, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de arroz y azúcar, como también en la compra de bebidas gasificadas y dulces al por mayor.
texts.en:
Nilda, 36, is a hardworking woman. She lives with three of her four children in the house she bought two years ago. She makes a living selling groceries. She opens the doors of her store in the morning to serve the area's inhabitants. She closes the store after a few hours and goes out to the fields to sell mainly soft drinks and juice. "It is a stable source of income for me, because I found a way to continue making sales. After 8 in the morning, the people in my town go out to work on their crops and they are not at home. Therefore, I am taking advantage of this opportunity to keep selling," she says. 

She would now like to increase her working capital in order to sell a larger variety of products. This is her second Kiva loan. She is grateful for the financial support she has received, because it allows her to continue moving forward. She is also committed to paying her installments on time. Nilda will invest these 2,500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of rice and sugar, as well as wholesale soft drinks and sweets.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soft drinks, among other products.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores operates a retail store within her village. She is happily married and has four children, of whom three are still studying, while the other one has already graduated from college.

Dolores' husband is a farmer and manages a car repair shop. The couple works hard in order to earn sufficient profits to support the education of their children and improve their way of life. 

Dolores has been a good borrower since she started borrowing additional capital from other lenders. For her to achieve her goals in life, she is asking for a loan of PHP30,000 to be used in purchasing  grocery items such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods and other basic commodities for her retail store. She believes that this will be of great help in progressing her business and for her to become a better entrepreneur. She hopes that the lenders will continue to support her financially in her efforts to make her retail store a viable source of income to secure the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her retail store

loans.name: Perlitas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, venta de mantas, venta de dulces, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es el octavo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, desde que aprendió la técnica de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de tejer) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
“Perlitas de Franz Tamayo” is a Communal Bank that will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. It is composed of nine members, guided by a directive board presided over by Rosa. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities, such selling salchipapas*, selling blankets, selling sweets, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling vegetables, weaving blankets.

Rosa is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says this is the eighth year she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having been invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She is currently running a handcrafts activity, weaving blankets. She says she has started this activity out of her own initiative, having learned the weaving techniques.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying a sewing machine; she will buy it at the fairs of the town of La Paz to then install it in her workshop. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her household as much as she can, as she is married and she has two children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

<cite>*Salchipapa is a typical dish composed of sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausages and French fries.</cite>

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es: Isolina, de 49 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Talía y Melisa  a las que cuida en su casa propia.Enviudó hace 15 años y desde entonces trabajó sin descanso para mantener a sus hijos cómodos y sobre todo brindándoles el amor de una familia unida. Su principal actividad económica es la consultoría de cosméticos de reconocidas marcas de belleza. Tiene a cargo a vendedoras, quienes ofrecen los productos en ventas horizontales. Ella es una líder, pues se encarga de motivarlas y que juntas lleguen a sus metas. Esto le gusta mucho pues, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy tolerante y empeñosa. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto y espera seguir consagrándose en el desarrollo de su línea profesional. Paralelo a ese trabajo, es encargada de proyectos educativos en los centros lejanos de su localidad, ahí realiza capacitaciones, talleres y demás medios de difusión.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.Isolina, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra cosméticos tales como cremas, rubores y otros productos para su negocio, pues no tiene capital de trabajo para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isolina, 49, is an independent woman. She lives with her two children, Talía and Melisa, and she cares for them in her own home. She became a widow 15 years ago, and since then she has worked tirelessly to keep her children comfortable, above all giving them the love of a united family. 

Her main business activity is a consultancy of cosmetics from well-known beauty brands. She has hired saleswomen who offer the products in horizontal sales. She is a leader, because she is in charge of motivating them so that they can reach their goals together. She likes this very much, because she is characterized as a very tolerant and persevering woman. She has been in this business for four years, and she hopes to continue devoting herself to her professional development. Aside from this work, she is responsible for educational projects in centers outside her community. There she conducts training, workshops, and other means of diffusion. 

This is her second Kiva loan. She is happy because she has the necessary capital to improve her business, and eventually her quality of life. Isolina will invest these 1,500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of cosmetics, such as creams, blush, and other products for her business, since she does not have the necessary working capital to supply her clients.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as creams, blush, and other products.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 36 años de edad es una mujer tímida. Vive en la casa que compró hace un año junto a sus pequeños hijos. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería, ella tiene su establo, a media hora de su casa, donde deja descansar a sus animales, en extensas áreas verdes. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a la crianza de ovejas, cerdos, vacas y toros, los que nutre y cuida con mucho esmero, pues depende de su buen cuidado, la venta de sus animales. Los que cada 3 meses comercializa a los carniceros que llegan a su casa o en la feria de la ciudad más próxima a su vivienda “todo depende del precio de venta si los carniceros ofrecen mayor precio, les vendo si no tengo que llevarlos a la feria”, comenta. Además aprovecha la oportunidad para trabajar en su terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra maíz, papa y cereales.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que le permite seguir con sus objetivos.  Marleni, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de 2 toros para engordarlos y semillas para sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Marleni, 36, is a shy woman. She lives in the house she bought one year ago along with her young children. 

Her main business activity is livestock. She has a stable half an hour away from her house, where she lets her animals rest in expansive green areas. She has been raising sheep, pigs, cows, and bulls for five years. She feeds and cares for them painstakingly because her animal sales depend on their good care. Every three months, she sells them to butchers who come to her home or at a market in the city closest to her home. "It all depends on the sale price. If the butchers offer a better price, I'll sell them. If not, I will have to bring them to the market," she says. She also takes advantage of the opportunity to work on her farmland, where she plants corn, potatoes, and grains. 

This is her second Kiva loan. She is grateful for the financial support she has received, because it allows her to continue with her goals. Marleni will invest these 3,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of two bulls to fatten and seeds for her farmland.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Gricelda Elizabeth

texts.es:
GRICELDA tiene 36 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Gricelda se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas. Solicita el créito para comprar blocoli, manzanas, papayas, kiwi, espinaca, rabano. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace mucha falta para vender a los clientes. El sueñoe es tener una tienda mucho más grande que la que tiene. Los desafíos  a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Gricelda is 36 years old, single, and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province. 

Gricelda sells fruits and vegetables. She is applying for the loan so that she can buy broccoli, apples, papayas, kiwi fruit, spinach and radishes. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she most needs for her customers. 

Her dream is to have a much larger store than the one she has. The challenges she faces are competition and poor weather. In her free time she likes to go for walks with her children.

loans.use: To buy broccoli, apples, papayas, kiwi fruit, spinach and radishes.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Patricia has an M-Pesa business (money transfer via mobile phones) which has been operational for over one year. She mentions stiff competition as a challenge in the business. With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to add to her float to facilitate her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to add to her float to facilitate her M-Pesa (money transfer) business

loans.name: Alternativa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTERNATIVA” iniciará el trigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta ropa interior, venta de artefactos, venta de bolsas, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa y de sábanas, venta de medias, venta de awayos, venta de cuadros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su esposo que es socio de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de linternas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió cuando se casó, conjuntamente su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de linternas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
“Alternativa” (Alternative) is a Communal Bank that will start its thirtieth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. It is composed of ten members, guided by a directive board presided over by María. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling underwear, selling artifacts, selling bags, selling cosmetics, selling bed sheets, selling tights, selling awayos*, selling paintings.

María is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having been invited by her husband who is a member of the institution. She currently runs a retail activity, selling lanterns, and she says she has started this activity with her husband when she got married.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying lanterns at wholesale price; she will buy them at the fairs of the town of La Paz, and being a street vendor she will then sell them in the fairs of the town of El Alto. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her household as much as she can, as she is single and she has she is married and she has three children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loan, the seminars and the health program.

<cite>*Awayos are a type of Bolivia blanket</cite>

loans.use: Compra de linternas

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 33 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura su principal siembra  es el maíz y maicillo, también se dedica los fines de semana a vender pupusas en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus cosechas y con la venta de las pupusas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 16 años,  doña blanca quiere seguir trabajando en la agricultura pero no posee de suficiente capital para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, y herramientas por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar lo antes mencionado y seguir con su trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 33 and has been farming for three years. Her main crops are corn and sorghum, and she also works weekends selling pupusas (Salvadoran stuffed corn tortillas) from her home. 

With the earnings she gets from selling her harvests and with the sale of the pupusas, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. 

She lives with her husband and her 16-year-old son. Blanca wants to continue working in agriculture, but doesn't have enough capital to buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, herbicides and tools. That is why she is applying for a loan so that she can buy the above-mentioned supplies and continue with her work. This will enable her to earn better profits and give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, herbicides and tools.

loans.name: Silfo Antonio

texts.es: Don silfo de 52 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija de 22 años en casa  propia, el se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 14 años siembra maíz, maicillo y jocotes, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don silfo solicita un crédito para comprar  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 52-year-old Silfo lives with his wife and his 22-year-old daughter in a house that he owns. He has worked in farming for the past 14 years. He grows corn, sorghum and jocotes. The sales he makes from his harvests allow him to afford part of his household expenses. Silfo requests a loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc., so that he can move forward with his crops and provide his family with more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura, an entrepreneurial married mother of four children, has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 27 years. Little by little with the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large number of customers in the local market, many of whom are local butchers.

Mashhura is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy young cattle to develop her business further. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, thereby providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, she will be able to offer her children access to a better quality education. Each month she will make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 32-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and a daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For 15 years, Musarat's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working, and it needs to be repaired. Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: To meet the repair cost of the taxi

loans.name: Monna Liza

texts.en:
This is Monna Liza, 24, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is still single, and she lives with her parents.  She is working hard continually, to provide income for her everyday expenses. Monna Liza offers massage services. She does a home service. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 900 every day, for her services.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.  

Monna Liza hopes that her business will grow and dreams of saving money, to help her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies needed in her massage service business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 31-year-old, married woman and mother of five children, from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a vegetable farming business. She plants various vegetables in her farm. This is the source of her income.

Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this loan, she will be able to plant more and harvest more from her farm. In the future, Evangeline dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married and supports a family of six. She has run a retail shop in Bomet town for the last four years receiving a monthly income of KES 10,000. She learned about KADET LTD from a family member who is a registered member of KADET LTD. 

With a first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to restock her retail shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g. crates of bread, tea leaves, packets of sweets, etc.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to restock her shop with consumable products, e.g. crates of bread, tea leaves, packets of sweets, etc.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
This is Marcela, 38, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Rey and a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Marcela maintains a direct selling business. She sells Glomal products, vitamins, juice and coffee. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of Glomal products, vitamins, juice, coffee and other products needed in her business.  

Marcela’s dream is for her business to grow bigger, and she is hoping to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of Glomal products, vitamins, juice and coffee needed in her business.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Esperanza, es madre soltera de una niña ya adolecente y trabaja como secretaria para una institución estatal desde hace 3 años, con sus ingresos espera darle todos los estudios a su pequeña hasta verla valerse por sí misma. Solicita el crédito para construir un sumidero, puesto que actualmente tiene en su casa una letrina y para mayor higiene requiere de este financiamiento para solucionar esta necesidad que viene presentando desde hace varios años y así contar con mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a single mother of a adolescent girl, and she has worked as a secretary at a State institution for three years. With her income she hopes to provide her child with an education until her daughter can take advantage of it for herself. 

She is requesting this loan to build a sewer, since she currently has a house with a latrine.  To improve the home's hygiene, she needs this loan to meet the need she has been facing for several years. Doing so will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase materials to install a sewer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella tiene un negocio de venta de licuados cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios, tiene mucha clientela pues  esta en lugar muy transitado de personas y los da a pecios muy accesibles, la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los licuados como:  fruta, azúcar, leche, vainilla, también para comprar: vasos, pajillas, bolsas, etc. y poder seguir atendiendo a su clientela y ella pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesita.
texts.en: The client lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. She has had a business selling milkshakes close to her home for several years. She has a lot of customers because her business is located in a busy area and her prices are very reasonable. The client is requesting a loan so she can buy all the necessary ingredients for making the milkshakes, such as fruit, sugar, milk, and vanilla, as well as glasses, straws, bags, etc. The loan will enable her to continue attending to her customers and to obtain better profits in order to give her family what they need.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, sugar, milk, vanilla, glasses, straws, bags, etc

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuan was born in 1957. She has two grown children, who have their own families. Her husband has retired. His pension is 2,000,000 VND per month. Xuan sells clothes to earn a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND a month. She has done this job for many years. Her family’s total income is about 6,000,000 VND per month.

Xuan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the previous loan cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to retail. Her dreams are to buy some more furniture for her house, and to enlarge her clothes shop.

Other members which are part of Xuan's group include the following:

Ha is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND, which she will use to sell beverages in her stall. 
Hoa is 46 years old. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND, and wants to use it to sell groceries in her store. 
Nga is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND. She will use the funds to sell clocks and watches in her shop. 
Nga is 35 years old. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND, which she will use to sell clothes in her shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to retail.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho is a 28-year-old hardworking lady who is the family breadwinner because her parents are elderly. She manages a tea plantation in Bomet town.

She learned about KADET LTD from a tea-buying centre where KADET LTD had organized a training for the farmers in the area. She has acquired her first loan of KES10,000, which she will use to buy fertilizer for the tea plantation.

She will use the proceeds to meet the family's basic needs. Her dream is to see the living standards of the family improve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the tea plantation

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1972. She has two sons who are learning at school. Her husband is a barber. He earns 2,000,000 VND per month. Hang cooks and sells breakfast to earn a living. She earns 4,000,000 VND a month. She has done this job for many years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND to buy more ingredients and food to sell breakfast in her food stall. Her dream is to be able to buy some more furniture for her house and to raise her children well.

Other members who are part of Hang's group include the following: 
	Thuy is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to sell beverages in her stall. 
	Phuong is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to sell beverages in her stall. 
                 Can is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to sell clothes in her shop.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and food to sell breakfast in her food stall.

loans.name: Ubaldo Ramon

texts.es: El señor Ubaldo habita en el municipio de Masaya, junto a su esposa e hijo, su mayor sueño es que su negocio aumente y tener una linea de bolsos en los diferentes mercados, su esposa tiene su propio negocio tambien vende ropa y entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, en la actualida don Ubaldo tiene 8 trabajadores quienes junto a el elaboran Bolsos  para  damas, Billeteras para caballeros y Fajas, con este credito compra Materiales que el utiliza para elaborar sus productos como: Cuero, Broches, Pega, Tijeras, Hilos, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Ubaldo lives in the town of Masaya along with his wife and son. His greatest dream is to see his business grow and to have a line of purses sold in various markets. His wife also has her own business. She sells clothing, and between the two of them, they split the household expenses. 

Ubaldo currently has eight workers who, along with Ubaldo himself, make purses for women, wallets for men, and belts.  With this credit, he will buy materials that he will use to create his products, such as leather, clasps, glue, scissors, thread, etc.  

He appreciates the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided him.

loans.use: purchase materials to make purses.

loans.name: Pedro Edwin

texts.es:
PEDRO tiene 37 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pedro es chofer profesional. Solicita el crédito para comprar un microhondas, cosina. Con la ayuda podrá comprar los artefactos que tanta falta le hace en el hogar. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.
El sueño es comprar un solar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y leer mucho.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old, married, and doesn't have children.  He lives with his wife in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  Pedro is a professional driver.

He is applying for this loan to buy a microwave and a stove.  With the assistance, he will be able to buy the appliances that are so needed in the home.  He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas.  

His dream is to buy a plot of land.  The challenges he faces are illnesses.  In his free time, he likes to rest and read a lot.

loans.use: to buy a microwave and a stove.

loans.name: Eli Oswaldo

texts.es: Eli es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años  maíz y sorgo. Eli desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Eli is a very responsible man who has always been known for giving the best to his family. He currently lives with his wife and his five-year-old son. He is a very hard worker, and he has always worked with joy and enthusiasm. He is a farmer; he plants corn and sorghum every year. Eli wants to increase his sales and for this reason he visited Apoyo Integral’s offices in order to request a loan so he can purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and other items. He wants help because he does not have other income, and through the loan he will be able to continue feeding his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and other items
